TA 4327-PRC: Flood Management Strategy Study 
Increase in Technical Assistance Amount 
 
1.  The  Flood  Management  Strategy  Study  advisory  technical  assistance  (TA)  was 
approved on 14 April 2004 in the amount of $500,000 equivalent from the Technical Assistance 
Special Fund.  The purpose of the TA is to develop an integrated flood mitigation and floodplain 
management strategy appropriate for the unique flooding and development situations in the 
People’s Republic of China (PRC), by balancing structural and nonstructural measures. It will 
help the Government move from flood control to an integrated flood management strategy. The 
Executing Agency is the Ministry of Water Resources. TA services commenced on 20 October 
2004 for a total of 44 person-months, comprising 9 person-months of international and 35 
person-months of local consultants.   
 
2.  The purpose of the TA is to help the Government develop strategies and policies to shift 
from past policies of flood control to an integrated flood management approach. An integrated 
flood  management  strategy  entails  integration  with  broader  water  resource  management 
objectives. In the PRC, integrating these aspects is particularly relevant because of the water 
supply  crisis  and  the  environmental  degradation  associated  with  rapid  development  and 
urbanization. The issues received specific mention by the vice premier last year in a speech. 
Interest  in  solving  these  problems  is  widespread  at  senior  levels  of  central  Government 
agencies. 
 
3.  The EA has requested ADB to provide supplementary financing to study the linkage 
between flood and water management in the PRC to identify ways that flood waters can be 
used to (i) improve groundwater recharge and offset periods of drought and rapidly growing 
water demand in urban and rural areas, (ii) stabilize river flows needed for growing urban and 
rural use, and (iii) improve the supply of water to ecologically important habitats and overall 
water quality. As an integrated flood and water management approach requires increasing 
cross-agency coordination, the institutional mechanisms needed to improve collaboration and 
coordination also need further assessment. The proposal involves expanding the scope of the 
TA, which focuses on integrated flood management, to include recommendations and actions 
needed to integrate flood management with water resource management objectives. 
 
4.  The Board is notified of the increase of the TA amount by $49,600 financed on a grant 
basis from the Cooperation Fund for the Water Sector, and the administration by ADB of the 
proposed cofinancing. In accordance with Project Administration Instructions (PAI) 5.11, paras. 
31 and 32, the Board is notified of this approval.
